title: Backcountry and Trail Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: The backcountry & the following trails are closed: Slaughter & Yucca Canyon & access roads, Guadalupe Ridge (visitor center to west park boundary), Rattlesnake Canyon, Juniper Ridge, Ussery, & Double Canyon. Cavern trails & the Old Guano Trail are open.

title: Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage
description: Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown at this time when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

title: Road Closures
description: The South Rim Road is currently closed beyond the Visitor Center. The East Portal and North Rim Roads are closed for the season.

title: Military Lifetime and 4th Grade Passes Not Available
description: We do not have Every Kid Outdoors 4th Grade or Military Lifetime passes at this time. All other passes may be purchased or issued Sun-Wed, with call ahead. Passes not guaranteed without calling in advance.

title: Loop Road and Campground Closed to Vehicles
description: The Loop Road and Lava Flow Campground are closed to automobiles for the season. Patches of ice and snow may be encountered when hiking the Loop Road. The Lava Flow Campground is walk-in tent camping only.

title: Fort Sumter Tours Cancelled
description: Due to high winds, all Fort Sumter Tours for Sunday November 27, 2022 have been cancelled. Please contact Fort Sumter Tours for more information at www.fortsumtertours.com

title: Boaters: Small Craft Advisory is in effect from 9 am on Sunday, Nov. 27 until 9 pm on Mon., Nov. 28.
description: The Nat. Weather Service has issued a Small Craft Advisory for coastal waters between Point Arena and Point Reyes, including Tomales Bay. Winds of 21–33 knots (24–38 mph) and/or steep waves are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.

title: North Rim Open for Day Use Only. —Sunday, November 27, 2022
description: Grand Canyon Lodge, food services, general store and North Rim Campground are closed for the winter. Travel with enough food and water for everyone in your group. NORTH RIM SCENIC ROAD to CAPE ROYAL is CLOSED FOR THE WINTER.

title: What's Closed, and What's Open This Week? —Sunday, November 27, 2022
description: Coconino County is now in CDC MEDIUM Community Level —Face Masks Are Not Required indoors, however physical distancing is encouraged indoors. South Rim Visitor Center is open 10 am to 4 pm. Visit the link for an updated list of what's open this week.

title: COVID Levels High - Masks Currently Required in Federal Buildings
description: Masks are required regardless of vaccination status in all public access buildings including the Kris Eggle Visitor Center and restroom facilities at Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument until community transmission levels for COVID-19 drop.

title: 4-wheel drive required on North and South Beach.
description: Driving beaches have reopened. 4-wheel drive is required at this time. Be aware of changing tides and check the tide chart before traveling on the beach.

title: Echo, Hole in the Wall and Cottonwood/Marble now open- Roadside camping permit required
description: Echo Canyon (to Inyo Mine), Hole in the Wall and Cottonwood/Marble Roads have reopened. A free permit is now required to camp along these roads. No permit is required for day use. Click below for more information.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – MASKS OPTIONAL – Week of November 25 - December 2, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its mask guidance to align with the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status for the upcoming week. This park spans 2 counties and will follow guidance for the county with higher levels.

title: Mask Status in Park Buildings – Masks OPTIONAL – Week of November 25 - December 2, 2022
description: The NPS has updated its masking guidance to align with the CDC’s new COVID-19 Community Levels tool, which helps communities decide what prevention steps to take. Each Friday, the park will update the mask status here for the upcoming week.

title: American Camp and English Camp Visitor Centers Closed Until Spring 2023
description: Our visitor centers have closed for the year. They will reopen in the spring and we will announce our hours and the dates of their reopening in 2023.

title: All Point Reyes National Seashore Visitor Centers will be closed on Sunday, December 25, 2022.
description: All Point Reyes National Seashore Visitor Centers (VCs) will be closed on Sunday, Dec. 25, 2022. During the winter holidays season, the VCs will otherwise be open regular hours, plus all VCs will be open on Monday, Dec. 26, 2022, and Monday, Jan. 2, 2023.

title: Face Masks Optional: Nov 25, 2022 Status Update
description: The NPS updated its masking guidance based on the CDC’s COVID-19 Community Levels tool. Steamtown NHS currently resides in a "LOW" COVID-19 community level area. Masks are optional indoors and on train rides.

title: Kenilworth Park Road Repairs and Turf Restoration
description: Over the next 4 months, road repairs will be made to the Deane Ave. extension through Kenilworth Park. The park will install temporary fencing, and regrading and re-seeding of the adjacent turf areas will be accomplished. Re-seeding will occur Spring 2023

title: Visiting Requirements Updated November 25, 2022
description: Masks are not required for entry, but you may choose to wear one. Entrance to Independence Hall is by tour only; timed entry tickets are required.

title: Closure
description: The park visitor center and Memorial building will close on winter holidays for Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years Day.

title: Ship Closures - C.A. Thayer and Balclutha
description: Due to king tides, historic ships C.A. Thayer and Balclutha will be closed November 25-26. Ships entrance fees will be suspended during this period

title: Steel Visitor Center is Closed for Construction
description: The visitor center at park headquarters is currently closed for a major rehabilitation project. Restrooms are available at Rim Village and Goodbye Picnic Area.

title: Wilderness Road Campground
description: Starting Monday, November 28,2022 only A(non-electric), B (electric), and C (electric) loops will be available to reserve at the Wilderness Road Campground until March 16, 2023.

title: Vegetation management project along Highway 1 near Muir Beach Overlook
description: Starting 11/22, a crew will thin vegetation on NPS land along Highway 1 near Muir Beach Overlook. The project, which continues for the coming weeks, reduces the risk of a wildfire to the surrounding community and provides a safe evacuation corridor.

title: Moores Creek National Battlefield Visitor Center to Close Thanksgiving Day (Nov. 24)
description: The Moores Creek National Battlefield Visitor Center will be closed on Thursday Nov. 24th in honor of Thanksgiving Day. The park entrance gates will open at 8 am providing access to trails and restrooms. The visitor center will reopen Friday Nov. 25 at 9.

title: January 2023 - April 2023
description: The Eleanor Roosevelt NHS (Val-Kill) will close for the Winter. The grounds will remain open every day. We will re-open in the Spring of 2023, date TBD.

title: Now through December 31st
description: Val-Kill Cottage is decorated for the Holiday and open for tours weekends only and on December 28, 29 and 30. Visit the Operating Hours & Seasons page for more information.

title: Temporary Closure of Wetlands Acadian Cultural Center, Thibodaux, LA
description: Due to building maintenance and floor replacement the Wetlands Acadian Cultural Center in Thibodaux will be closed for approximately three weeks, beginning November 29, 2022.

title: Holiday Closure Notice
description: The park buildings will close at 3:00 pm Wednesday, November 23, 2022 and will be closed on Thursday, November 24, 2022 observance of the Thanksgiving Day Holiday. Most hiking trails remain open. Be safe and enjoy your time at the park.

title: Riverside Trail to Hot Springs NOW OPEN
description: The riverside trail to the springs has been repaired and is now open.

title: Jockey Hollow Visitor Center Restrooms Closed
description: The restrooms at the Jockey Hollow Visitor Center have been closed due to water line issues. The restrooms at the New York Brigade Comfort Station remain open. The comfort station is located about halfway around the tour road, by the Western Avenue exit.

title: Reduced Speed Limit on North Parkway
description: The speed limit on the northern section of the parkway has been reduced to 40 MPH in the work zone during the rehabilitation project. Click the link to sign up for updates on the project.

title: Depot Street Work/Closures
description: Be aware that the town of Greeneville is working on Depot St. adjacent to the Visitor Center and on the other side of Main Street. This may impact your ability to access the site and parking lot. If your route is impacted, please call 423-638-3551.

title: Major Construction Project has Begun at the Fall River Entrance to Rocky Mountain National Park
description: Fall River Entrance to RMNP is under construction. One lane is open to enter. Visitors are encouraged to avoid the Fall River Entrance and use the Beaver Meadows Entrance via U.S. Hwy 36. Expect wait times at both major east side entrances to RMNP.

title: Check Twitter for updates on current conditions; roads/facilities may close due to adverse weather
description: Roads and facilities in the park may close at any time. Always check MountRainierNPS on Twitter for updates before coming to the park (account not required to view though may need to refresh browser if prompted for a login.)

title: Upcoming Visitor Center Closures - Park Remains Open During the Holidays
description: Park roads, trails, and campgrounds will remain OPEN. All park visitor centers will be CLOSED on Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's Day. Visitor centers will also be closing at 3:00 pm the day before these holidays.

title: NPS Roads 5 & 6 closed for repair
description: NPS Roads 5 & 6 are closed for repairs now through February 2023. The backcountry roads through the park's northern and eastern sections are receiving a new gravel base along with repairs to culverts and the Highland Creek bridge.

title: Holiday Closure
description: The Visitor Center will be closed on Thursday, November 24, Thanksgiving Day. Park grounds will be open to the public from sunrise to sunset. The Visitor Center will reopen Friday, November 25 at 9:00 am.

title: Tioga Road and Glacier Point Road are closed for the winter
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually reopen in late May or June. Tire chains may be required on other roads; call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions.

title: Park Closures Sometimes Due to Inclement Weather.
description: At times due to inclement weather the park may close for the day. This is due to icy roads and snow drifts across the roads around and within the park.

title: Holiday Hours
description: Park trails will remain open sunrise to sunset every day. Park buildings, including the Sandburg Home, barn and restrooms, will be closed on: Thanksgiving Day, Nov. 24, Christmas Eve, Dec. 24, Christmas Day, Dec. 25, and New Year’s Day, Jan. 1.

title: Bridge E on Oakridge Trail Closed
description: Bridge E on the Oakridge Trail is closed. This bridge closure impacts the Oakridge Trail by making it an out and back and will lengthen the distance of the River Trail.

title: The fort will close at 3:00 pm on December 2 and 3, 2022 to prepare for special event
description: The fort will close at 3:00 pm on December 2 and 3, 2022 to prepare for a special event. Information about the special event can be found at https://www.nps.gov/beol/learn/news/evening-candlelight-tours.htm

title: Harry S Truman National Historic Site Closed Thanksgiving Day, December 25, and January 1.
description: The park is closed Thursday, November 24, Sunday, December 25, and Sunday, January 1. The grounds of the Truman Farm are open daily sunrise to sunset, with a grounds tour available on the NPS App.

title: GRAND PORTAGE TRAIL CLOSURE
description: UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE, THE SECTION OF TRAIL BETWEEN OLD HIGHWAY 61 AND FORT CHARLOTTE IS CLOSED.

title: Closed on Thanksgiving Day (11/24)
description: Aztec Ruins National Monument will be closed on Thursday, November 24. No entrance is permitted for any reason. The park will reopen on Friday, November 25.

title: Covid-19 Mask Mandate
description: In accordance with CDC guidance for counties with high transmission rates, masks are required in the visitor center and all park buildings.

title: Fort Hill and Hemenway Water Line Project
description: Beginning 11/7, waterline work will begin on Fort Hill Road followed by Hemenway Landing Road. There will be minor traffic disruptions during construction, but roads and sites will remain open with flaggers. Work is expected to be completed by 12/2.

title: Current Mask Policy in Visitor Center - week of November 20, 2022
description: Consistent with CDC guidance regarding areas at a LOW COVID-19 community level, masks are optional for visitors to Little Rock Central High School NHS, regardless of vaccination status, inside all park buildings.

title: Closed on Thanksgiving Day (Nov. 24, 2022)
description: The El Morro Visitor Center and park trails will be closed on Thanksgiving Day so that our staff may spend time with their families. The campground will remain open for camping. The visitor center and trails will reopen at 9 am on Friday, Nov 25.
